Prior to this interview I knew very little about [**Marion Beilles**]( http://ina-iv.blogspot.com/). My knowledge extended to three facts: she’s French, she’s computer literate enough to send me an email and she takes rather wonderful photos. Her work was actually passed on to me by friend of the site, [**Not a Thing To Believe In**](http://notathingtobelievein.bandcamp.com/), the New York based solo artist who’s receiving a fair amount of attention leading up to his sophomore LP.

Regardless of the quality of the work, Beilles’ pieces seem remarkably unsettled, jumping from fashion photography to conceptual narrative driven arrangements, there’s an unsettled quality that bizarrely manages to support the menacing atmosphere rooted in her photos.

The result is actually a pretty coherently composed stream of images, so perhaps i was talking shit the whole time. Check out her work in the slide-show above and shuffle over to her [blog](http://ina-iv.blogspot.com/) if you’re that way inclined.

**CITR:** What originally attracted you to photography?

A year ago now, I found a silver camera in my grandfather’s attic. I started taking photos with the camera, liking it more and more as I went along. But I also look at a lot of photo blogs – that’s what attracted me to it in the first place.

J’ai trouvé dans le grenier de mon grand-père il y 1 ans maintenant, un appareil photo argentique. J’ai commencé à faire des photos avec cet appareil et au fur et à mesure j’y ai pris goût. Mais je visite aussi beaucoup de blogs photo c’est ce qui m’a donné l’envie d’en faire.

**CITR:** From the look of your work, a lot of them are self-portraits. What attracts you to that area of photography?

At the beginning I took photos primarily for myself; I had fun making profile pictures for my web page. But now I’ve started using models, I find it a lot more interesting because I can do things I wasn’t able to do alone.

Et bien au départ je prenais des photos avant tout pour moi, je m’amusais à me faire mes photos de profil pour ma page internet. Mais dorénavant je ne prend que des modèles, je trouve ça beaucoup plus intéressent car je peux faire plus de choses que ce que je ne peux faire toute seule.

**CITR:** We never see your face though. Could you explain this?

I like that my face isn’t visible; I much prefer the element of mystery. Then there’s the fact that I’m not particularly photogenic \[haha\].

Je trouvais plaisant le fait de ne pas voir mon visage, j’aime bien laisser une part de mystère. Et puis je ne me trouve pas spécialement photogénique haha

**CITR:** If you could shoot one person or place, what would it be?

As you can see on my blog, many of my photos are taken outdoors. I’d be interested in finding an abandoned \[or ruined\] house where I could do a shoot that’s a bit sinister – it’s an atmosphere \[or ambience\] that really appeals to me, even if my photos don’t really show it.

Comme vous pouvez le voir sur mon blog, beaucoup de mes photos sont faites en pleins air. Alors ça m’intéresserait de trouver une maison délabrée ou je pourrais faire un shoot un peu glauque car c’est une ambiance que j’apprécie beaucoup. Même si mes photos ne le montrent pas forcément.

**CITR:** What do you look for in an environment before shooting?

I don’t look for anything in particular, unless I have a really clear idea of what I want to do. I think it all depends on the context.

Je ne cherche pas quelque chose de précis, à part quand j’ai une idée bien déterminée. Tout dépend du contexte je pense.

**CITR:** Some of your work seems to be, or at least influenced by, fashion photography. Is this something you’re interested in?

Fashion really interests me – I’ve been hooked since the age of two. I’m thinking of moving in that direction a bit later on. That’s my aim anyway.

La mode m’intéresse particulièrement. Depuis deux ans je m’y intéresse énormément, je pense m’orienter vers ce milieu plus tard. C’est un peu mon objectif

**CITR:** What are your plans for 2011?

I’d like to try and develop as a photographer, to take all the photos I’d like to. Then it’s my plan to have a go at making videos. Let’s hope that works! \[haha\]

Je veux essayé de progresser dans la photographie, arriver à faire les photos que je souhaite. Puis j’ai comme projet de me lancer dans la vidéos. Espérons que ça marche! haha
